description: Comprehensive model versioning strategy with support for semantic versioning, custom schemes, and AI-managed version control

Version.description: Represents a version with scheme information

operations.name: version_model
operations.description: Assign version to model with automatic or manual version determination

changes.description: List of changes for AI analysis

formula.description: Automatic SemVer version determination based on changes
steps: 1. If version specified, validate and use it directly
a. If breaking changes exist → MAJOR bump
b. If new features exist → MINOR bump
c. If only bugfixes/patches → PATCH bump
3. Get current version v_current = (M, m, p)
4. Compute new version based on bump type:
6. Store version with model_id and metadata

properties.idempotency: No (each call creates new version unless version specified)

edge_cases.handling: Initialize as 1.0.0 for SemVer, current date for CalVer

operations.name: check_compatibility
operations.description: Check version compatibility between two versions using scheme-specific rules

steps: 1. Parse versions: v_a = (M_a, m_a, p_a), v_b = (M_b, m_b, p_b)
2. Apply compatibility rules based on level:
backward: M_a == M_b AND (m_a > m_b OR (m_a == m_b AND p_a >= p_b))
3. Check for special cases (pre-release, build metadata)

semver_compatibility_rules.major_version_zero: 0.y.z - API may change at any time
semver_compatibility_rules.major_version_nonzero: x.y.z - MAJOR incompatible, MINOR backward compatible
semver_compatibility_rules.backward_compatible: 1.5.3 is compatible with 1.2.0 (same major, higher minor/patch)

properties.idempotency: Yes (same inputs always produce same result)

edge_cases.handling: Treat as unstable, strict compatibility only

result.reason: Different major versions indicate breaking changes

warnings: Pre-release versions may have breaking changes

operations.name: resolve_version
operations.description: Resolve version constraints to find best matching version

edge_cases.handling: Exclude pre-release unless prefer=latest and no stable

operations.name: migrate_version
operations.description: Migrate model between versions with automatic strategy generation

strategy.description: Migration strategy (optional, auto-generated if not provided)

steps: 3. Create backup of current model state
4. If dry_run: simulate migration and return results
7. If validation fails: rollback to backup

edge_cases.handling: Allow with explicit confirmation, may lose data

test_cases.precondition: v2.0.0 removes required field with no default

test_cases.postcondition: Complete rollback to 1.0.0, no partial state

operations.name: deprecate_version
operations.description: Mark version as deprecated with timeline and migration path

end_of_life_date.description: Date when version will be removed

steps: 1. Validate version exists and is not already end-of-life
4. Update version metadata with deprecation flag

lifecycle_states.archived: Version is removed from active use

properties.idempotency: Yes (deprecating already deprecated version updates metadata)

test_cases.description: Deprecate old version with migration target

input.reason: Multiple critical bugs fixed in 2.0.0. Performance improvements. New features.

operations.name: register_versioning_scheme
operations.description: Register custom versioning scheme for extensibility

steps: 5. Make scheme available for all version operations

properties.idempotency: No (registering same scheme twice is error)

test_cases.postcondition: TestScheme can be used in version_model operation

operations.name: compare_versions
operations.description: Compare two versions and return ordering relationship

steps: 1. Validate both versions use same scheme
2. Parse versions: v_a = (M_a, m_a, p_a), v_b = (M_b, m_b, p_b)
if M_a != M_b: return sgn(M_a - M_b)
if m_a != m_b: return sgn(m_a - m_b)
if p_a != p_b: return sgn(p_a - p_b)

properties.transitive: Yes (if a > b and b > c, then a > c)

operations.name: get_version_history
operations.description: Get complete version history with changelog for model

steps: 2. If from_version specified: filter versions >= from_version
3. If to_version specified: filter versions <= to_version
4. If include_deprecated=false: filter out deprecated versions
6. For each version, retrieve changelog entry

properties.time_complexity: O(n log n) where n = number of versions

history.versions: Sorted in ascending order by version

operations.name: auto_version
operations.description: AI automatic versioning with intelligent change analysis

steps: - Change clarity: Clear vs ambiguous changes
- User hint quality: Detailed vs vague

properties.idempotency: No (may produce different results with updated AI)
properties.user_friendly: Yes (non-technical users can rely on auto-versioning)

operations.name: validate_version
operations.description: Validate version format according to scheme rules

steps: 2. Check format using regex or scheme-specific validator
b. Validate numeric components are non-negative integers
c. Validate pre-release and build metadata format
5. If valid: parse version into components

properties.time_complexity: O(n) where n = version string length
